newsitem.title: CHINA: China's B share indices end down, A indices up.
newsitem.headline: China's B share indices end down, A indices up.

text.p: China's B share indices ended down but the A share indices were up on Tuesday with little impact seen from new provisions on securities-related crime, brokers said.

China has added provisions on securities-related crimes to its criminal law to help curb insider trading and price manipulation on the financial markets, the Shanghai Securites News reported on Tuesday.
Shanghai's B index fell 0.018 points or 0.03 percent to 70.88 on volume of 20.151 million shares worth $10.448 million.

Brokers said falls of Heilongjiang Electric Power and losses on the A share market later in the session erased early gains, but active institutional support for real estate developer Shanghai Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone Development prevented the market from further losses.
Heilongjiang fell $0.036 or 2.63 percent to $0.740 after it proposed a 0.17325 yuan per share dividend for B share holders based on its 1996 net profit of 124.92 million yuan.
Shanghai Lujiazui traded the most and became the star on institutional buying, rising $0.026 or 2.78 percent to $0.960 on volume of 3.6 million shares.
Textile machinery maker Shanghai Erfangji was the biggest loser on expectations of poor 1996 results, slipping $0.010 or 5.55 percent to $0.170 on volume of 945,600 shares.
Shenzhen's B share index shed 0.34 points or 0.20 percent to 169.65 points on turnover of HK$216.7 million.
"What we saw in the afternoon session is just a minor correction," a broker said. "The market will continue its upward trend after the correction."
On the B share market, Shenzhen Chiwan Petroleum Supply Base Co Ltd was the biggest loser, down HK$0.13 or 2.64 percent to HK$4.80 on volume of 693,900 shares.
Shanghai A shares ended up, but off intraday highs on profit-taking, triggered by investor concerns over possible government intervention to cool down the market, brokers said.
The index gained 4.477 points or 0.37 percent to 1,217.230 on volume of 977.8 million shares worth 11.9 billion yuan.
The SSE30 index rose 20.178 points or 0.63 percent to 3,235.234 points.
Tientsin Marine Shipping was the star on talk about its dividend plans, surging 1.25 yuan or 10.01 percent to 13.73 on volume of 2.8 million shares.
Shenzhen's A share index inched up 2.05 points or 0.48 percent to 425.7 points on turnover of 12.4 billion yuan.
Hunan Zhenghong Feed Co Ltd, which listed 45 million shares on Tuesday, closed at 18.98 yuan compared with an offering price of 7.06 yuan, on volume of 27.0 million shares.
